fundingtype.column_description: Indicates the charter school funding type
fundingtype.value_description: Values are as follows:  ·       Not in CS (California School) funding model  ·       Locally funded  ·       Directly funded

charter.column_description: This field identifies a charter school.
charter.value_description: The field is coded as follows:  ·       1 = The school is a charter  ·       0 = The school is not a charter

charternum.value_description: 4-digit number assigned to a charter school.

soc.column_description: The School Ownership Code is a numeric code used to identify the type of school.
soc.value_description: •      08 - Preschool       •       09 – Special Education Schools (Public) •      11 – Youth Authority Facilities (CEA) •       13 – Opportunity Schools •       14 – Juvenile Court Schools •       15 – Other County or District Programs •       31 – State Special Schools •       60 – Elementary School (Public) •       61 – Elementary School in 1 School District (Public) •       62 – Intermediate/Middle Schools (Public) •       63 – Alternative Schools of Choice •       64 – Junior High Schools (Public) •       65 – K-12 Schools (Public) •       66 – High Schools (Public) •       67 – High Schools in 1 School District (Public) •       68 – Continuation High Schools •       69 – District Community Day Schools •       70 – Adult Education Centers •       98 – Regional Occupational Center/Program (ROC/P)

doc.value_description: The District Ownership Code (DOC) is the numeric code used to identify the category of the Administrative Authority. •       00 - County Office of Education •       02 – State Board of Education •       03 – Statewide Benefit Charter •       31 – State Special Schools •       34 – Non-school Location* •       52 – Elementary School District •       54 – Unified School District •       56 – High School District •       98 – Regional Occupational Center/Program (ROC/P)  *Only the California Education Authority has been included in the non-school location category.

gsserved.column_description: It is the lowest grade and the highest grade of student enrollment as reported in the most recent certified CALPADS Fall 1 data collection. Only K–12 enrollment is reported through CALPADS. This field may differ from the grade span offered.
gsserved.value_description: 1.     Only K–12 enrollment is reported through CALPADS  2.     Note: Special programs at independent study, alternative education, and special education schools will often exceed the typical grade span for schools of that type

free meal count (ages 5-17).value_description: eligible free rate = Free Meal Count / Enrollment

numtsttakr.column_description: Number of Test Takers in this school
numtsttakr.value_description: number of test takers in each school

chain_of_thought_reasoning: The question asks for the ratio of locally funded schools in Santa Clara County compared to all other types of charter school funding. The hint suggests counting the number of locally funded schools in Santa Clara and dividing it by the total number of schools in Santa Clara, then multiplying by 100. This requires identifying schools in Santa Clara, determining their funding type, and filtering for locally funded schools. The database schema provides the necessary information, and the tables that need to be used are those that contain this information.

The question asks for the ratio of locally funded schools in Santa Clara County compared to all other types of charter school funding. To answer this, we need to identify schools in Santa Clara County, filter them by charter funding type, and then calculate the ratio. The hint provides a clear formula for the ratio, which involves counting locally funded schools and all funding type schools in Santa Clara. Based on this, we can identify the necessary columns.

SQL: SELECT CAST(SUM(CASE WHEN FundingType = 'Locally funded' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS REAL) * 100 / COUNT(FundingType) FROM schools WHERE County = 'Santa Clara' AND Charter = 1

chain_of_thought_reasoning: I first identified the relevant tables and columns mentioned in the question. The question is asking for the ratio of locally funded schools in Santa Clara County to all other types of charter school funding. I noticed that the value 'Locally funded' appears in the column Charter Funding Type of table frpm, and the value 'Santa Clara' appears in the column County Name of table frpm, as well as in the column City of table schools and the column MailCity of table schools. I also noticed that the value '1' in the column Charter of table schools indicates a charter school. I then constructed the SQL query to count the number of locally funded schools in Santa Clara County and the total number of charter schools in Santa Clara County, and calculated the ratio as a percentage.
SQL: SELECT CAST(SUM(CASE WHEN f.Charter Funding Type = 'Locally funded' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS REAL) * 100 / COUNT(*) FROM frpm f WHERE f.County Name = 'Santa Clara' AND f.Charter = 1

candidate_generation.Question: What is the ratio in percentage of Santa Clara County schools that are locally funded compared to all other types of charter school funding?
candidate_generation.Evidence: Ratio in percentage = (count(locally funded schools in Santa Clara) / count(all funding type schools in Santa Clara) * 100%
candidate_generation.GOLD_SQL: SELECT CAST(SUM(CASE WHEN FundingType = 'Locally funded' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS REAL) * 100 / SUM(CASE WHEN FundingType != 'Locally funded' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) FROM schools WHERE County = 'Santa Clara' AND Charter = 1
candidate_generation.PREDICTED_SQL: SELECT CAST(SUM(CASE WHEN FundingType = 'Locally funded' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS REAL) * 100 / COUNT(FundingType) FROM schools WHERE County = 'Santa Clara' AND Charter = 1

revision.Evidence: Ratio in percentage = (count(locally funded schools in Santa Clara) / count(all funding type schools in Santa Clara) * 100%

revision.PREDICTED_SQL: SELECT CAST(SUM(CASE WHEN f.Charter Funding Type = 'Locally funded' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS REAL) * 100 / COUNT(*) FROM frpm f WHERE f.County Name = 'Santa Clara' AND f.Charter = 1
